interlinear-text.item: ELA Bobo Sufi was living in Avgarch

phrase.item: This story is about when Boboi Sufi was living in Avgarch, and for irrigating his land he sent his children off to different places. There was a holy person called Ibrahim who went to Gircha to irrigate [the fields].
At that time Gircha was a very scary place, because it had monsters.
Whenever someone went to irrigate the land there, they would try to reach Avgarch before it got dark.
So when Ibrahim came to Gircha to do the irrigating,
after he had done it all, he thought of taking a nap.
And so since he was sleeping he [later] opened his eyes and saw that the sun had set already.
So at that time he decided to sleep in the same place.
though [people] were scared to be in Gircha because of the monsters.
At night Ibrahim heard a monster's voice.
‎‎The monster said, "Hey, Ibrahim!
I am coming to eat you, OK?"
Ibrahim was aware of the monster coming.
He made a fire, then he lit the wick, and readied his [old-fashioned] weapon.
Then whenever someone knocked on the door, he readied his weapon, but he became unconscious.
In Avgarch, people were really worried.
In the morning they brought a coffin when they came to him, for they were sure that a monster had eaten Ibrahim.
There was a place between Avgarch and Vircha, called Bandben. when they [people] came the, Ibrahim met them there.
A coffin was brought.
Ibrahim told them all the story of what had happened.
He told them, "When you go to Gircha, there is my pocket knife in that house there."
People were very happy to see him, but when they came to Gircha they saw that in that house there was a dead crow and Ibrahim's pocket knife was on top of [the crow].
